meanings.sent1: He jives his friends by telling them made-up stories.
meanings.sent2: She always jives her little brother into believing funny things.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat jives the dog by hiding its toys.
meanings.sent4: The magician's tricks jives the audience into thinking they saw real magic.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox jives the other animals with his cunning ways.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to his jives about aliens visiting Earth.
meanings.sent2: Her constant jives about winning the lottery are getting old.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jives had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His jives were like a never-ending stream of silly jokes.
meanings.sent5: The politician's jives were seen through by the attentive crowd.

meanings.definition: Jives: a style of dance and music popular in the 1940s and 1950s
meanings.sent1: The energetic jives at the dance party brought everyone to the dance floor.
meanings.sent2: The classic jives of the swing era are still enjoyed by many today.
meanings.sent3: Grandma showed off her jives from the olden days at the family reunion.
meanings.sent4: The lively jives of the jazz band filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The smooth jives of the dancers matched perfectly with the upbeat music.
